description: Event value analysis - which events are worth your time/money and how to prepare

free.label: Free
free.description: Full rewards achievable through normal gameplay

medium_spend.label: Medium Spend ($20-50)
medium_spend.description: Moderate spending needed for good rewards

S.label: Must Do
S.description: High value rewards for effort/cost. Never skip.

C.label: Low Priority
C.description: Skip unless you have excess resources.

bear_trap.name: Bear Trap
bear_trap.description: Alliance rallies against Raging Bear. Damage-based rewards.
bear_trap.gameplay: A giant bear spawns near your alliance. Your alliance launches 5-hero rallies against it. Rally LEADERS use all 3 heroes' Expedition skills. Rally JOINERS only contribute their first hero's top-right expedition skill. Damage dealt = points = rewards. Coordinate timing to maximize rallies in 30 minutes.

tips: Rally LEADERS: Use your best 2 Marksman + 1 Infantry (see Recommended Heroes above)
Rally JOINERS: Only your FIRST hero's TOP-RIGHT expedition skill counts!
Best joiners: Jessie (+25% DMG at L5) - put her in slot 1 even at low level
Only top 4 highest-level joiner skills apply to the rally
Activate Troop Attack, Lethality, and Deployment Capacity boosts before event
Set up 3 march presets beforehand - every second counts in 30 minutes
Launch new rally every 50-60 seconds; have 5-6 marches ready per player
Position rally leaders close to Bear to minimize march time
Upgrade Explosive Arrowheads from Lighthouse Intel for +25% alliance damage

leader.reasoning: Need at least 1 of each troop type to activate all 3 hero Expedition skills. Marksmen deal most damage.

joiner.reasoning: Personal buffs don't factor into joiner calculations. Pure Marksmen for maximum damage contribution.

bear_trap.notes: One of the best F2P events. Jeronimo's Natural Leader passive gives +15% Lethality/Health even when not used.

crazy_joe.name: Crazy Joe
crazy_joe.description: 21 waves of bandit attacks on your alliance. Coordinate defense for maximum points.
crazy_joe.gameplay: Crazy Joe attacks your alliance in 21 waves! Send your troops to reinforce alliance members' cities. When their city gets attacked, your troops defend and earn points based on kills. Waves 10 and 20 target ONLY the Alliance HQ. Waves 7, 14, 17 target ONLY online players (double points!). Waves 17-19 give ~31% of total points. Coordinate with alliance to maximize kill distribution.

tips: Use your best 3 Infantry heroes (see Recommended Heroes above)
Use EXPEDITION skills (not exploration) - this is defense combat
Don't heal troops mid-event - healed troops stay in your city and steal kills from reinforcers
Reinforce ONLINE players - they get hit more often (waves 7, 14, 17) = more points for your troops
Reinforce cities with FEWER other reinforcements - less competition for kills = more points for you
After wave 10, recall troops from HQ and go back to reinforcing cities
Coordinate with alliance to spread reinforcements evenly rather than stacking on one player

wave_mechanics.wave_10: Targets ONLY Alliance HQ - recall troops and send to HQ after wave 9
wave_mechanics.wave_20: Targets ONLY Alliance HQ - recall troops and send to HQ after wave 19
wave_mechanics.online_waves: Waves 7, 14, 17 target ONLY online players - double points!
wave_mechanics.high_value_waves: Waves 17-19 give ~31% of total points - be ready

troop_ratio.reasoning: Infantry engage first in combat. With enough stats/numbers, they kill all bandits before Lancers or Marksman can attack. Same ratio for both city defense and HQ waves.

crazy_joe.notes: High-value F2P event. Coordinate with alliance. If a city loses 2 waves, it stops generating points - prioritize defending weaker members.

svs_prep.name: SvS Preparation Phase
svs_prep.description: 5 days of daily tasks earning points. Winning state gets attack advantage in Battle Phase.
svs_prep.gameplay: Your entire state competes against another state by earning points. Each day has different point-earning activities (Day 1: building/research, Day 2: heroes, Day 3: beasts, etc.). You do normal gameplay but DURING the right day to earn points. Save your speedups, shards, and materials beforehand, then spend them on the matching day. Your state's total points vs theirs determines who attacks in the battle phase.

day_2_basic_skills.name: Day 2: Basic Skills Up
day_2_basic_skills.note: General Shards do NOT count - only specific hero shards

day_3_beast_slay.name: Day 3: Beast Slay
day_3_beast_slay.note: NO SPEEDUP POINTS on Day 3! Coordinate Polar Terror rallies with alliance.

day_4_hero_development.name: Day 4: Hero Development / Training

efficiency_analysis.description: Should you use speedups to train more troops, or save them for Day 1/2/5?
efficiency_analysis.conclusion: PROMOTE existing troops (better than speedups). T9→T10 is best. Don't train NEW troops with speedups.
optimal_strategy: 2nd: Promote T8→T9 (0.64 p/s) - still beats speedups
Save speedups for Day 1/2/5 instead of training new troops
Training new T10 directly (0.39 p/s) is worse than speedup points
Don't bother promoting lower tiers (T7 and below) - poor value

day_4_hero_development.note: NO SPEEDUP POINTS on Day 4! T9→T10 promotion (0.71 p/s) is BEST, beats speedups. T8→T9 also good. Training NEW troops loses to speedups.

save_before: ALL Speedups (Day 1, 2, 5 only - NOT Day 3 or 4!)
tips: SPEEDUPS ONLY GIVE POINTS ON DAY 1, 2, AND 5 - not Day 3 or 4!
General Hero Shards do NOT give points - only named hero shards count!
Day 4: T9→T10 promotion is BEST (0.71 p/s), beats speedup value (0.50 p/s)
Day 4: T8→T9 also great (0.64 p/s). Lower tiers are poor value.
Day 4: Training NEW troops (0.39 p/s) loses to speedups - save speedups for Day 5
Wait for President buffs before using resources
Coordinate Polar Terror rallies on Day 3
Save Mithril specifically for Day 4 - 40,000 points each!
Building upgrades just need to START on that day - don't need to finish

svs_prep.notes: Prep phase is as important as battle. Winning prep = attack advantage + healing buffs in battle.

svs_battle.name: SvS Battle Phase
svs_battle.description: Cross-state PvP combat. Capture Sunfire Castle to win.
svs_battle.gameplay: Portals open to the enemy state! You teleport to their territory and attack enemy cities, or stay home and defend yours. The main goal is capturing Sunfire Castle in the center and holding it. Your alliance coordinates rallies on enemy cities and the castle. When attacked, your heroes and troops defend. Killing enemies and holding the castle earns points. Troop losses are partially recovered after the battle ends.

mechanics.attack_range: Can only attack within ±3 Furnace levels
mechanics.win_condition: Hold Sunfire Castle for 2.5 hours consecutively
mechanics.troop_revival: Field Triage phase after - 30-90% troop recovery

tips: Use your best expedition heroes (see Recommended Heroes above)
EXPEDITION skills matter, not exploration
Attack rallies: Use Jessie in slot 1 for +25% damage joiner skill
Garrison defense: Use Sergey in slot 1 for -20% damage taken
Bookmark weak targets before battle starts
Keep shield up when not actively fighting
Defense is as important as offense
Reinforce allies even if low power
Coordinate rally timing with R4/R5

svs_battle.notes: Prep phase winner attacks. Organized states beat higher power disorganized states.

alliance_showdown.name: Alliance Showdown
alliance_showdown.description: 6-day alliance vs alliance competition. 13 Victory Points available - first to 7 wins!
alliance_showdown.gameplay: A 6-day 1v1 alliance battle against a similarly-powered alliance from another state. Each day has different point-earning tasks. The alliance with more points at day's end wins that day's Victory Points. Day 1 is worth 1 VP, Days 2-5 are worth 2 VP each, and Day 6 is worth 4 VP (13 total - need 7 to win). Runs parallel with Tundra Trade Route event.

victory_points.description: 13 Victory Points total - need 7 to win
victory_points.strategy: Win Day 6 (4 VP) + any 2 other days = victory. If you lose Day 6, you need to win 4 other days.

eligibility.alliance_requirement: Only top 20 alliances by power can participate
eligibility.joining_rule: Must be in alliance BEFORE event starts - cannot join mid-event
eligibility.points_threshold: 300,000+ Personal Points required for ranking rewards

star_system.description: Win/loss affects your alliance's star rating
star_system.star_rewards: Higher stars = better Tundra Truck decoration rewards (+1% Troop Defense)

tundra_trade_route.description: Concurrent companion event - truck escorting and raiding
tips: Hide YOUR OWN state's trucks to avoid accidentally raiding allies
Prioritize raiding trucks from other states
Daily Chests give Truck Vouchers - always claim them
Truck Vouchers help during Tundra Trade Route
Use your best expedition heroes for PvP (see Recommended Heroes above)
Day 1 = 1 VP only. If already winning, SAVE resources for later days!
Day 6 = 4 VP. Invest HEAVILY on Day 6 - it often decides the winner
Win Day 6 + 2 others = guaranteed victory (7 VP)
If you lose Day 6, you need to win 4 of the other 5 days
300K+ Personal Points required for ranking rewards - always hit this threshold
Always claim Daily Chests for Truck Vouchers (helps Tundra Trade Route)
Must join alliance BEFORE event starts - no mid-event switches
Coordinate with alliance leadership on which days to push hard

alliance_showdown.notes: Strategic event where picking your battles matters. Don't overspend on Day 1 (1 VP). Push hard on Day 6 (4 VP). Star ratings carry over to future events. Runs alongside Tundra Trade Route for bonus rewards.

hall_of_chiefs.name: Hall of Chiefs
hall_of_chiefs.description: Week-long power competition. 7 daily stages with different point activities. Top rewards include seasonal hero shards.
hall_of_chiefs.gameplay: A week-long competition where everything you upgrade earns points. Complete buildings, finish research, train troops, level heroes - all of it counts. You're ranked against other players in your state. The key is SAVING all your speedups and materials beforehand, then dumping everything during this event. Top rankers get massive rewards including legendary hero shards. Season 1 features Jeronimo (6 days), Season 2+ features Philly (7 days).

stages.activities: Lucky Wheel, Hero Ascension, Pet Refinement
Lucky Wheel, Hero Ascension, Pet Refinement

scoring.troop_training: Points scale with troop tier - T7+ gives significantly more

tips: HOARD RESOURCES for months before this event - patience wins
Lucky Wheel on Hero Development days = 8,000 points per spin!
Start big research/construction projects 1 day BEFORE their stage - complete after reset for instant points
Train T7+ troops on Combat Training days for maximum points
Day 1 only gives 1 Victory Point - don't overspend early
Wait until many players have spent their resources, then use yours for better rankings
F2P players: Focus on Beast Slay and Troop Training stages - these don't require spending
Always hit milestone rewards every day even if not competing for leaderboard
These stages favor activity over spending
Pre-load training queues before daily reset
Save gathering speed boosts for Resource Gathering day
Fill stamina before hunting days for fast beast kills

hall_of_chiefs.notes: Best rewards in game but competitive. F2P can rank well by saving speedups for months. Top 10 finishers get hero shards. Always get milestone rewards even if not competing.

king_of_icefield.name: King of Icefield
king_of_icefield.frequency: Monthly (replaces Hall of Chiefs after State of Power)
king_of_icefield.description: Cross-state 7-day competition. Better rewards than Hall of Chiefs. Compete against 6 other states!
king_of_icefield.gameplay: A month-long cross-state competition with 7 daily stages. Unlike Hall of Chiefs, you compete against players from SIX different states, not just your own. Each day has a specific focus (construction, hero dev, training, etc.) and rewards. Save resources for their matching days. Earn medals daily (2 per day) to unlock hero shards. Better rewards than Hall of Chiefs but requires broader strategy since you're competing cross-state.

daily_stages.description: 7 days with specific focus and rewards each day

stages.activities: Building upgrades, Fire Crystals (2K pts each)
Lucky Wheel, Pet Refinement, Hero Ascension

scoring.medals: 2 medals per day from hitting daily point requirements
scoring.state_rank_threshold: 250,000+ total points for State Rank rewards

medal_system.description: Earn medals daily to unlock additional rewards
medal_system.medal_shop: Trade medals for Mythic Hero Shards and rare items

tips: You compete against 6 OTHER STATES - broader strategy needed
Fire Crystals give 2,000 points each on Day 1 and 5
Lucky Wheel gives 8,000 points per spin on Hero Development days (Day 2 and 7)
Pre-load troop training queues before Days 4 and 6, complete after reset
Troop PROMOTION points = difference between tier levels (promotes are efficient)
Crystal Dust only available after War Academy unlocks
F2P: Prioritize speedups early, save expensive resources (FC, Shards, Mithril) for later days
Always hit daily point requirements for 2 medals per day
250K+ total points required for State Rank rewards
Focus on speedups for City Construction day
Train T7+ troops on Combat Training days for maximum points
Pre-load training queues before daily reset
Save expensive resources (FC, Shards) for later when you can calculate if you'll hit thresholds
Always get milestone rewards even if not competing for top ranks

king_of_icefield.notes: Replaces Hall of Chiefs after your state completes State of Power. Better rewards but cross-state competition. Day 7 (Hero Development) gives Mythical Shards as daily reward - save best resources for then!

snowbusters.name: Snowbusters
snowbusters.description: Mini-game: Drive snowplow, collect coal, rescue survivors.
snowbusters.gameplay: A mini-game where you drive a snowplow through a snowy map. Use fuel to move and clear snow, collecting coal and rescuing survivors along the way. Clearing sections earns rewards. The catch? Fuel regenerates slowly, and you hit a wall fast without buying fuel packs. Fun but pay-to-progress. F2P players should just do the free daily attempts and not stress about it.

tips: FREE players hit a wall quickly
Packs required to progress past early stages
Rewards are mostly cosmetic + small resources
Skip if F2P or light spender

snowbusters.notes: FUN but PAY-TO-PROGRESS. F2P should skip or just do free attempts.

fishing_tournament.name: Fishing Tournament
fishing_tournament.description: Catch fish for points. Bait costs resources or money.
fishing_tournament.gameplay: Cast your line into an ice fishing hole and wait for fish to bite. You spend bait items to fish - each cast might catch common junk or rare valuable fish. Different fish are worth different points. You rank against other players based on total points. The problem? Bait regenerates slowly for free, and you hit a wall fast. Buying bait packs lets you fish more, but the rewards rarely justify the cost. Just do your free casts and move on.

tips: Bait is the bottleneck
Free bait = minimal rewards
Not worth spending money on
Do free attempts only

fishing_tournament.notes: Poor value. Do free attempts only. Don't buy bait packs.

lucky_wheel.name: Lucky Wheel
lucky_wheel.description: Spin for hero shards. Main way to get new legendary heroes.
lucky_wheel.gameplay: A gacha wheel featuring a specific hero. You spend gems (1,350 per spin, or 13,500 for 10 spins) or free tickets to spin. Each spin gives random rewards - mostly small stuff, but you have a chance at the featured hero's shards. Reaching spin milestones guarantees shards. This is THE main way to unlock new legendary heroes. Be selective - only spin for heroes worth building.

tips: ONLY spin for heroes you actually need
Check hero tier before investing
Save tickets/gems for featured S+ heroes
10-spin is more efficient than singles

lucky_wheel.notes: Primary hero acquisition method. Be selective - don't spin for every hero.

artisans_trove.name: Artisan's Trove
artisans_trove.description: Craft chief gear and charms at discount during event.
artisans_trove.gameplay: The blacksmith offers bonus rewards when you craft chief gear! Spend your saved gear materials (Hardened Alloy, Design Plans, etc.) to craft or upgrade chief gear. You get the normal gear PLUS bonus rewards like speedups and resources. Never craft gear outside this event - always wait for Artisan's Trove to get the free bonuses.

tips: SAVE all gear crafting for this event
Bonus rewards for crafting during event
Focus on one gear set at a time

artisans_trove.notes: Best time to craft gear. Save materials and craft during event only.

tundra_trading.name: Tundra Trading Station
tundra_trading.description: Trade resources at special exchange rates.
tundra_trading.gameplay: A traveling merchant arrives with special exchange rates! You can trade resources you have excess of (like meat or wood) for resources you need (like iron or coal). Check the exchange rates carefully - some trades are good value, others aren't. Good for balancing your resource stockpile. Quick event, just check once, do your trades, done.

tips: Good for converting excess resources
Check exchange rates before trading
Don't trade resources you actually need

tundra_trading.notes: Useful for resource balancing. Free value.

flame_lotto.name: Flame Lotto
flame_lotto.gameplay: A lottery wheel where you spend Flame currency to spin. Each spin gives random rewards - speedups, resources, hero shards, or even rare items. You accumulate Flames from various activities throughout the week. The KEY rule: NEVER spend Flames outside this event! Hoard every single Flame you earn, then dump them all during Flame Lotto for maximum spins and milestone rewards.

backpack_items: Varies - can include legendary shards, speedups, rare materials

save_before: ALL flames - don't spend between events
tips: NEVER spend flames outside this event
Save all flames for Flame Lotto
Best value for flame currency

flame_lotto.notes: Save ALL flames for this event. Best flame value.

mix_and_match.name: Mix and Match
mix_and_match.description: Purchase packs to unlock matching rewards.
mix_and_match.gameplay: A spending event where buying packs unlocks bonus rewards. The more packs you buy of a certain type (like FC packs or Steel packs), the more bonus materials you unlock. Think of it as a 'buy 5 get 1 free' deal. Only worthwhile if you were already planning to buy packs - don't let this event trick you into spending money you weren't going to spend anyway.

backpack_items: Depends on pack type - FC, Steel, etc.

tips: Only worth it if you were buying packs anyway
Focus on ONE material type for best bonuses
Don't buy packs JUST for this event

mix_and_match.notes: Good if you're already spending. Don't spend BECAUSE of this event.

treasure_hunter.name: Treasure Hunter
treasure_hunter.description: Complete tasks to dig for treasure rewards.
treasure_hunter.gameplay: Complete daily tasks to earn shovels, then dig for buried treasure on a grid. Each dig reveals either a reward or nothing. Some tiles have better loot than others. It's basically a mini-game that rewards you for normal gameplay - complete your dailies, get shovels, dig for free stuff. No special strategy needed, just participate.

tips: Complete daily tasks to earn digs
Free rewards for normal gameplay
No special preparation needed

treasure_hunter.notes: Free rewards for playing normally. Always participate.

canyon_clash.name: Canyon Clash
canyon_clash.description: Three-way alliance warfare. Control structures to win.
canyon_clash.gameplay: Three alliances battle on island map. 4 phases: Prep (3 min), Seize & Conquer (17 min), Fortress Occupation (20 min), Citadel Onslaught (20 min). FUEL is the key resource - manage it carefully! First alliance to control key structures wins.

phase_strategy.phase_1_prep: 3 minutes - organize teams, plan attack routes
phase_strategy.phase_2_seize: 17 min - Capture all buildings on YOUR island first, then block enemy bridges
phase_strategy.phase_3_fortress: 20 min - Defend your fortresses; send left/right teams to invade enemy fortresses
phase_strategy.phase_4_citadel: 20 min - Concentrate forces on the Citadel - first to defeat its final guardian wins!

fuel_management.critical_rule: FUEL is the most important resource - NEVER run out mid-battle
tips: Assign Guardians to increase fuel income
Use conscription to replenish troops in buildings (cheaper than revives)
Save fuel and play defensive when reserves are low
Push only when situation is good; otherwise hold chokepoints
Use your best expedition heroes for combat (see Recommended Heroes above)
Split into 3 teams - 2 strong players per team, strongest player on third team
Deploy 2 squads for offense, 1 for defense on chokepoints
NEVER go solo - you will die repeatedly without team coordination
Holding 2 fortresses nearly guarantees victory
Phase 1: Secure your island buildings FIRST before attacking bridges
Phase 4: ALL focus on Citadel - first to defeat final guardian wins

canyon_clash.notes: Fuel management wins battles. Coordinate teams and hold chokepoints. Never go solo!

flame_and_fang.name: Flame and Fang
flame_and_fang.description: PvE event: Hunt Firebeasts, complete Intel Missions, earn Crystallite Cores for Fire Crystals and speedups.
flame_and_fang.gameplay: Firebeasts appear on the map! Hunt them solo with your exploration heroes for Crystallite Cores. Also complete Intel Missions (refresh 3x daily) for more cores. Spend your cores in the event shop on Fire Crystals, speedups, or resources. The trick is saving yesterday's Intel missions and claiming them after the event starts for bonus cores. Spend ALL cores before event ends or they turn into worthless meat!

timeline.action: Complete missions but DO NOT CLAIM
CLAIM saved missions + complete new refresh

spending_priority.warning: Unspent cores convert to 10K Meat each - total waste!

tips: DAY BEFORE: At 16:00, complete Intel missions but DON'T CLAIM
This trick gives you 16 extra cores (184 vs 168)
Intel missions only last 15 hours - don't miss refreshes
Spend ALL cores before event ends - leftover = wasted as Meat
Prioritize Fire Crystals over everything else

flame_and_fang.notes: Great F2P event. Use the pre-event trick for 16 extra cores. NEVER leave cores unspent.

foundry_battle.name: Foundry Battle
foundry_battle.description: Alliance battlefield - capture and hold buildings for points.
foundry_battle.gameplay: Three 15-minute phases. Capture buildings to earn points over time. Imperial Foundry is the key to victory - appears in Phase 2. Troops get injured (not killed) and heal after 12 minutes or with speedups. 50% of stored points scatter when a building is retaken - loot them!

scoring.loot_mechanic: When enemy retakes a building, 50% of stored points scatter - anyone can loot them

phase_strategy.phase_1: Capture Boiler Room, Repair Facility, Central Transit, Prototype Sites
phase_strategy.phase_2: IMPERIAL FOUNDRY appears - send strongest troops here! This is the key to victory
phase_strategy.phase_3: Random Weapon Workshops spawn - F2P players focus here

tips: Imperial Foundry = key to victory - prioritize it in Phase 2
Leave garrison of 4-5 players at each key building
Use Central Transit to reduce advanced teleport cooldown by 50%
Troops only get injured, not killed - heal with speedups or wait 12 min
Offense gives 2x points vs defense (80 vs 40 per 10K power)
Loot scattered points when buildings change hands (50% of stored points)
F2P: Focus on safe buildings and Weapon Workshops in Phase 3

foundry_battle.notes: Imperial Foundry control wins the event. Coordinate with alliance to hold key buildings.

hero_rally.name: Hero Rally
hero_rally.description: Accumulate points from various activities for hero shards.
hero_rally.gameplay: A week-long event featuring a specific hero. You earn points through normal gameplay activities - completing buildings, training troops, using speedups, etc. Reaching point milestones rewards you with the featured hero's shards. It's basically a bonus for playing the game normally, with extra rewards if you spend. Check if the featured hero is actually worth building before going hard on this event.

tips: Check if featured hero is worth it
Points come from normal gameplay
Spending accelerates progress

hero_rally.notes: Good way to get specific heroes. Value depends on featured hero.

mercenary_prestige.name: Mercenary Prestige
mercenary_prestige.description: Defeat 50 Phaethon Mercenaries across difficulty tiers. Features personal challenges and alliance boss fights.
mercenary_prestige.gameplay: A monthly PvE event where you fight through 50 levels of Phaethon Mercenaries. Each level gets harder. Every 10th level (10, 20, 30, 40, 50) is a BOSS with better rewards - call team rallies on these! Alliance R4/R5 can summon Phaethon Captains for group fights. You must complete all 50 levels on one difficulty to unlock the next (takes minimum 10 events to reach Insane difficulty). Two progression tiers: Champions (normal rewards) and Legends (Fire Crystals, Chief Gear materials).

tips: Use Gina (4+ stars) in your team to reduce stamina costs by 20%
Every 10th level is a BOSS - call team rally for better rewards
Scout costs 15 stamina, solo attack 10 (8 with Gina), rally 25 (20 with Gina)
If stuck, ask alliance member to rally your level - you still get rewards
You get 5 help requests per event (+1 each time you help someone)
Alliance Captains: Everyone hits once FIRST, then send full rally march
30 minute timer on Alliance Captains - coordinate quickly
Save help requests for higher difficulty levels you can't beat
Start with Gina for stamina savings, swap to main team when stuck

alliance_challenge.name: Phaethon Captains
alliance_challenge.strategy: Everyone taps once, then full rally

mercenary_prestige.notes: Excellent F2P event with valuable rewards. Gina is essential for stamina efficiency. Progress unlocks permanently - each difficulty takes 10 events minimum to unlock. Legends tier gives Fire Crystals and Chief Gear materials.

brother_in_arms.name: Brother In Arms
brother_in_arms.description: Alliance kill event. Attack enemy cities and gathering nodes to earn points.
brother_in_arms.gameplay: A PvP event where your alliance earns points by killing enemy troops. Attack enemy cities (especially unshielded ones) and hit gathering nodes where enemies are collecting resources. Coordinate with alliance to target weak enemies and maximize kills. Points are based on troop tier killed - higher tier = more points.

tips: Scout before attacking - find unshielded cities with troops
Target gathering nodes - easy kills with less retaliation risk
Coordinate rallies on bigger targets with alliance
Keep your own gatherers shielded or recalled during event
Higher tier troop kills = more points
Use anti-scout if you have troops to protect

troop_ratio.reasoning: Balanced composition for attacking cities. Infantry absorbs damage, marksmen deal damage. Adjust based on target's composition.

brother_in_arms.notes: Good event for active players. Coordinate timing with alliance. Avoid attacking much stronger players - target appropriately.

tundra_arms_league.name: Tundra Arms League
tundra_arms_league.description: Cross-state league competition with tiered matchups.
tundra_arms_league.gameplay: A cross-state competitive event where states are matched based on power. Complete various activities to earn points for your state. Rewards scale based on league tier and final ranking. Requires state-wide coordination for best results.

tips: Check your state's league tier for expected competition
Coordinate with state leadership on point strategies
Save resources for high-point activities
Participate in all available point-earning tasks

tundra_arms_league.notes: Rewards depend heavily on state coordination and league tier.

frostdragon_tyrant.name: Frostdragon Tyrant
frostdragon_tyrant.description: Alliance boss event. Rally against the Frostdragon for massive rewards.
frostdragon_tyrant.gameplay: A powerful dragon boss spawns that requires alliance coordination to defeat. Launch rallies against the Frostdragon - damage dealt determines your reward tier. Similar to Bear Trap mechanics but with a dragon boss. Coordinate rally timing for maximum participation.

tips: Similar strategy to Bear Trap - use expedition skills
Rally leaders use Marksman-heavy compositions
Joiners put Jessie first for +DMG skill
Coordinate rally timing with alliance
Position rally leaders close to dragon

leader.reasoning: Maximize DPS against boss. Need 1 of each type to activate all expedition skills.

joiner.reasoning: Pure marksmen for maximum damage contribution.

frostdragon_tyrant.notes: High-value event. Treat like Bear Trap - expedition skills and rally coordination matter most.

frostfire_mine.name: Frostfire Mine
frostfire_mine.description: Mine resources from dungeon levels. Progress through increasingly difficult stages.
frostfire_mine.gameplay: Enter the Frostfire Mine dungeon and clear stages to collect resources. Each stage has enemies to defeat. Deeper stages have better rewards but tougher enemies. Use your exploration team to progress as far as possible.

tips: Use exploration skills team (Philly healer is essential)
Progress as deep as your team can handle
Don't waste attempts on stages you can't clear
Upgrade exploration skills for better progress

frostfire_mine.notes: Exploration-focused event. Your exploration team strength determines progress.

tundra_album.name: Tundra Album
tundra_album.description: Collection system with permanent stat bonuses. Earn album shards by completing in-game events.
tundra_album.gameplay: The Tundra Album is a collection system that runs for the entirety of playing the game. You earn album shards and puzzle pieces by completing events, unlocking heroes, and progressing through the game. As you unlock more things, you get more pieces. Each completed album page grants PERMANENT stat bonuses to your account - this adds up significantly over time!

tips: Album shards come from completing events - just play normally
Prioritize pages with combat stat bonuses (ATK, DEF, HP, Lethality)
Check which items you're close to completing
As you unlock heroes and content, more pieces become available
Album bonuses are PERMANENT - huge long-term value
This is a marathon, not a sprint - progress naturally over time

stat_bonuses.note: Bonuses are permanent and apply to all troops

tundra_album.notes: 100% F2P - earn shards by completing events and unlocking content. Critical long-term progression that runs for the life of your account. The stat bonuses compound and make a real difference in combat!

alliance_championship.name: Alliance Championship
alliance_championship.description: Pick your top 3 heroes and optimal troop ratio. Alliance members compete in bracket-style tournaments.
alliance_championship.gameplay: Each player picks their TOP 3 HEROES for their lineup. The game auto-deploys you with 33/33/33 troop ratio but this is NOT optimal - change it! Your lineup fights automatically against opponents. PvP buffs (minister, pet, battle) work so ensure they're active when you register. F2P players should register later in the phase to coincide with pet buffs and city bonuses for maximum points.

save_before: Activate all PvP buffs before registering
tips: Pick your TOP 3 strongest expedition heroes
Change troop ratio from default 33/33/33 to 50/20/30
Activate minister, pet, and battle buffs BEFORE registering
F2P: Register later in phase when buffs are active

troop_ratio.reasoning: Infantry frontline tanks damage, protecting Lancers and Marksmen in backline for max damage output. This ratio is balanced and hard to counter.

alternative_ratios.note: Minimal marksmen, used by some top alliances

alliance_championship.notes: Pick your best 3 heroes and set 50/20/30 ratio. No universal 'best' ratio - large stat gaps override strategy. Activate all buffs before registering!

labyrinth.name: Labyrinth
labyrinth.description: Multi-zone exploration dungeon with 6 zones. Progress for exclusive gear and materials.
labyrinth.gameplay: A permanent dungeon with 6 distinct zones: Frozen Tundra, Scorched Desert, Verdant Forest, Dark Caverns, Crystal Caves, and Infernal Depths. Each zone has multiple stages with increasing difficulty. Clear stages to earn zone-specific materials and exclusive gear. Your exploration team strength determines how far you can progress.

tips: Philly is ESSENTIAL - her healing keeps your team alive
Use exploration skills, not expedition
Don't skip zones - progress systematically
Upgrade hero gear to push further
Each zone has unique mechanics - learn them
Reset attempts refresh daily - use them all

labyrinth.notes: Critical PvE content for gear progression. Philly's healing is the key to deep progress. Take it zone by zone.

speedups.tip: Hall of Chiefs is primary. SvS Prep Day 1, 2, and 5 ONLY - Days 3 & 4 give NO speedup points!

fire_crystals.tip: Save ALL Fire Crystals for SvS Prep Day 1. 2,000 points per FC.

hero_shards.tip: Save specific hero shards for SvS Prep Day 2. General shards DON'T count!

lucky_wheel_tickets.tip: Save tickets for SvS Prep Day 2. 8,000 points per spin.

wild_marks.tip: Save Wild Marks for SvS Prep Day 3. Advanced = 15,000 pts each.

mithril.tip: NEVER use Mithril outside SvS Prep Day 4. 40,000 points per unit!

essence_stones.tip: Save Essence Stones for SvS Prep Day 4.

stamina.tip: Day 3 Polar Terror rallies need stamina. Max before Battle Phase. Mercenary Prestige uses 1,250-2,000 stamina per event.

flames.tip: NEVER spend flames outside Flame Lotto. Save every single one.

gems.tip: Save gems for Lucky Wheel spins on S+ tier heroes only.

crafting_materials.tip: Don't craft gear outside of Artisan's Trove event.
